org.openstreetmap.osm.data.mysql
Class ConstrainedCurrentNodeReader

java.lang.Object
  org.openstreetmap.osm.data.mysql.ConstrainedBaseReader<Node>
      org.openstreetmap.osm.data.mysql.ConstrainedCurrentNodeReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Releasable, ReleasableIterator<Node>, java.util.Iterator<Node>
public class ConstrainedCurrentNodeReader
extends ConstrainedBaseReader<Node>

Reads current nodes from a database ordered by their identifier.

Author:
Brett Henderson

Nested Class Summary
static class ConstrainedCurrentNodeReader.COMPARESTYLE
          When searching for nodes by name, compare the search-expression via SQL-"LIKE" or for string-equality?
static class ConstrainedCurrentNodeReader.CONDITION
          When searching for nodes by tag-values, do all tag-values of the search-expressions have to match or only one?

Creates a new instance that will read all nodes within a bounding-box..

Parameters:
loginCredentials - Contains all information required to connect to the database.
aminLat - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned
amaxLat - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned
aminLon - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned
amaxLon - only the elements within/intersecting this bounding-box will be returned

ConstrainedCurrentNodeReader

public ConstrainedCurrentNodeReader(DatabaseLoginCredentials aCredentials,

                                    ConstrainedCurrentNodeReader.CONDITION aOr,
                                    ConstrainedCurrentNodeReader.COMPARESTYLE aLike)
Creates a new instance that will read all nodes that have tags matching the given condition.

Parameters:
aCredentials - Contains all information required to connect to the database.
aTags - name-value -pairs
aOr - combine the different values in aTags via AND or via OR.
aLike - compare the names and values via SQL-"like" or literaly
